entry.title: Combined summary - Floating-Point Nakamoto Consensus
entry.summary: A proposed update to the Bitcoin network called Floating-Point Nakamoto Consensus has been released, which aims to improve the consensus generation process in blockchain networks. The update proposes a fitness test to determine the fittest solution block and incentivizes miners to adopt the dominant chain. It can be implemented as a soft-fork and adapted by other networks. However, some experts have raised concerns about its incentive-compatibility and stability. The proposal is less susceptible to 51% attacks and Byzantine fault injection than traditional Nakamoto Consensus, thereby improving network stability. In email threads and discussions on the bitcoin-dev mailing list, experts have discussed different aspects of this proposal. Some suggest that using floating-point arithmetic could improve scalability and efficiency while maintaining security, while others argue for increasing block creation times to avoid mining races. Experts also discussed the challenges of resolving disagreements and the potential threats of malicious actors exploiting denial-of-service vulnerabilities.In response to concerns raised about short-term disagreements and malicious attacks in blockchain networks, a new consensus algorithm called Floating-Point Nakamoto Consensus has been proposed. The algorithm uses fitness tests to determine the most fit solution block, incentivizing miners to adopt the dominant chain and ensuring global consensus is achieved more quickly. The proposed update can be implemented as a soft-fork and can be adapted by other networks. However, there are concerns over the risks associated with increasing block creation times due to potential mining races. Additionally, inter-block time may need to be increased in consideration of interplanetary communications times. Despite these challenges, Floating-Point Nakamoto Consensus offers a promising solution for improving network stability and determinism in decentralized blockchain networks.The article covers various discussions and proposals related to improving the consensus algorithm used in blockchain networks, with a focus on Bitcoin.
